headline: Why auto tariffs will be extra harsh on Ford, GM, & Stellantis
summary: The Big Three automakers — Ford (F), General Motors (GM), and Stellantis (STLA) — are the most exposed to US President Trump's auto tariffs, even when compared to foreign automakers, according to auto data firm JATO Dynamics. Senior Autos Reporter Pras Subramanian joins Julie Hyman and Josh Lipton on Market Domination Overtime to take a closer look at the auto sector. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime here.

headline: Qorvo (QRVO) and Ford (F), Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE), HP (HPQ) Shares Plummet, What You Need To Know
summary: A number of stocks fell in the afternoon session after markets gave up early gains with optimism over progress in US-China trade talks quickly fading as the Trump administration announced plans to raise tariffs on all Chinese imports to well above 100%.

headline: Tariffs Create Opening for ‘Made in America’ Ads—With Carefully Chosen Words
summary: Ford Motor Company released an ad campaign this month titled “Committed to America,” stating that it assembles more vehicles in the U.S. and employs more hourly workers in the country than any other automaker.
